title: Harpers Ferry National Historical Park: 2016 NPS Centennial Events at Harpers Ferry
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     2016 NPS Centennial Events at Harpers Ferry              2016 NPS Centennial Events at Harpers Ferry       On this page: Superintendent's Welcome Message | 2016 NPS Centennial Events at Harpers Ferry        Harpers Ferry's entrance sign in the Fall NPS Photo/Cook  Welcome to Harpers Ferry National Historical Park! We are excited to have you join us in celebrating the 100th anniversary of the National Park Service (NPS). On August 25, 1916, Congress passed the National Park Service Organic Act “to conserve the scenery and the natural and historic objects and the wildlife therein and to provide for the enjoyment of the same in such a manner and by such means as will leave them unimpaired for the enjoyment of future generations.” What a challenging mandate, but one that daily inspires the men and women of the NPS. We are working to protect these special places for you, your children, your grandchildren and many generations to come. This celebration is not only about honoring the past but envisioning the future by welcoming a new generation of visitors and stewards to their national parks. Harpers Ferry National Historical Park is proud to be one of over 400 units of the National Park System preserving decades of American history and stunning landscapes. At the confluence of the Potomac and Shenandoah rivers, you encounter a compelling history in our American narrative. George Washington chose Harpers Ferry as the site for a US Armory and from there early manufacturing innovations fueled the Industrial Revolution. It was here that abolitionist John Brown struck a blow against slavery that ignited a Civil War, trapping the town between the North and the South. In the wake of the war’s devastation, legendary Civil Rights leaders met at Storer College and “claimed every single right that belongs to a freeborn American.”  To showcase these inspiring sites and share these amazing stories, Harpers Ferry NHP, along with our park partners, will be offering an array of special events, workshops, hikes, tours, and educational and living history programs in 2016. The park is promoting the national “Every Kid in a Park” program, and adopting a centennial class at Harpers Ferry Middle School. In June, the park will host the unveiling of an America the Beautiful Quarters® Program coin in partnership with the United States Mint.  As you can see, we have a full agenda planned. We look forward to seeing you out on the trails, enjoying a concert, or participating in a tour or workshop. You will be renewed and inspired by visiting a national park. After all, they belong to YOU to preserve, protect, and enjoy for generations to come.  – Rebecca L. Harriett, Superintendent      2016 NPS Centennial Events at Harpers Ferry The Buffalo Soldier and the Birth of the National Park Service Date: February 2, 2016 Time: 2 pm Location: John Brown Museum, Lower Town Description: Black History Month exhibit opening ceremony with special guest speaker and reception.  National Park Week Date: April 16-24, 2016 Time: 10 am - 3 pm Location: Lower Town Description: Events and activities commemorating the Centennial of the National Park Service (NPS). The week kicks off April 16 with "A Day in the Park," giving visitors the opportunity to have fun while learning how the NPS operates.  BioBlitz Date: May 20-21, 2016 Time: 10 am - 4 pm Location: Bolivar Heights Battlefield and Nash Farm Description: Join teams of volunteer scientists, families, students, teachers, and other community members to find and identify as many species of plants, animals, microbes, fungi, and other organisms as possible. To participate as a volunteer citizen scientist, please register for the event. For a detailed schedule of the event, please see the corresponding calendar entry.  America the Beautiful Quarters® Program at Harpers Ferry National Historical Park Date: Coin Forum - June 7, 2016;  Launch Ceremony - June 8, 2016 Time: Coin Forum - 6:30 pm; Launch Ceremony - 10 am Location: Coin Forum - Gathering Tent, Lower Town; Launch Ceremony - Hamilton Street, Lower Town Description: The evening before the quarter launch, the United States Mint hosts a coin forum, giving the general public an opportunity to learn and ask questions about the United States Mint and its programs. The America the Beautiful Quarters® Program launch features speakers and the unveiling of the new quarter honoring Harpers Ferry National Historical Park. Visitors may purchase up to $100 worth of Harpers Ferry quarters in $10 rolls. Authors and Artists: A Centennial Gathering Date: June 11, 2016 Time: 10 am - 5 pm Location: Gathering Tent, Lower Town Description: Harpers Ferry Historical Association celebrates the National Park Service Centennial and its own 45th anniversary with a gathering of authors and artists. The day features book signings and readings as well as a silent auction of original art and photographs and limited edition prints by Mort Künstler and John Paul Strain. 15th Annual Don Redman Jazz Heritage Awards & Concert Date: June 25, 2016 Time: 5 pm Location: Mather Training Center Lawn, Camp Hill Description: Commemorate internationally influential musician Don Redman, 1920 graduate of Storer College, with performances by the 2016 Jazz Heritage Award honorees Albert "Tootie" Heath and Charles McPherson. The evening includes the awards ceremony, the Don Redman Next Generation Jazz Camp Scholars, and the Howard Burns Quartet with special guests. Prepare a picnic and bring your family and friends. An Evening with the Charles Washington Symphony Orchestra (CWSO) Date: July 9, 2016 Time: 6 pm Location: Mather Training Center Lawn, Camp Hill Description: CWSO presents America's Most Beautiful: a concert of great works by American composers from the last century celebrating the beautiful lands in our national parks. Join the CWSO for a summer evening of music by Gershwin, Barber, Copland, and other favorites. Bring along a picnic and your family and friends. An Evening of Music with the Ambassadors Date: July 16, 2016 Time: 6 pm Location: Mather Training Center Lawn, Camp Hill Description: The NPS and the Harpers Ferry Historical Association present an evening of spirituals and gospel music featuring the local singing group, the Ambassadors. Prepare a picnic and bring your family and friends. A President's Vision, A Captain's Challenge Date: July 24, 2016 Time: 3pm and 7pm Location: The Green, Lower Town (3 pm) and Mather Training Center Lawn, Camp Hill (7 pm) Description: A 1-hour historical drama, featuring Bill Barker as Thomas Jefferson and Richard Cheatham as Meriwether Lewis. Q&A will follow. The national meeting of the Lewis & Clark Trail Heritage Foundation will take place in Harpers Ferry on July 24-27. Public events include walking tours, sign dedication, and guest speakers. Schedule of events and registration at www.lewisandclark.org. The Confluence Festival Date: August 20, 2016 Time: 11 am - 8 pm Location: Hamilton Street, Lower Town Description: Celebrate the 100th birthday of the National Park Service at Harpers Ferry National Historical Park on Saturday, August 20th from 11:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. Bring a blanket, a picnic and lounge in the shade on the Shenandoah River Shoreline for a day of music and memories. Activities will include seven live musical acts, youth and adult art activities and a jam tent for performers and visitors alike. Come find your park and celebrate the rich musical and storytelling heritage of Harpers Ferry and the greater region. For full details see our event page. Niagara Movement Pilgrimage to John Brown's Fort Date: August 21, 2016 Time: 8 am Location: Murphy-Chambers Farm Description: Retrace the footsteps of the men and women of Niagara (now the NAACP) during this 110th anniversary walk and ranger-led tour to the site of the John Brown Fort in 1906. A 10 am memorial service will follow at the Curtis Freewill Baptist Church on Camp Hill. 100th Anniversary NPS Founders' Day Naturalization Ceremony Date: August 25, 2016 Time: 11 am Location: Lower Town Description: Commemorate the 100th anniversary of the National Park Service with a US Citizenship and Immigration Service naturalization ceremony featuring guest speakers, music and reception.        Ranger with InstaMeet participants holding an NPS Centennial sign NPS Photo/Cook
